Author: Brian Santo
Article: On Semiconductor has answered the question of who would replace outgoing president and CEO Keith Jackson, having just named former Cypress Semiconductor CEO Hassane El-Khoury his successor, effective immediately. El-Khoury became a free agent after having negotiated the sale of Cypress to Infineon for a little over $10 billion last year. The sale was announced in 2019, but it was held up a bit as the Trump Administration considered blocking it, before ultimately granting its approval. The deal ended up being finalized last April. Jackson announced his retirement a little over two months ago, in late September. On Semi board chairman Alan Campbell said the search committee interviewed both internal and external candidates, and finally settled on El-Khoury, who Campbell said was selected for his experience. Hassane El-Khoury Jackson, meanwhile, had taken over what was essentially the cast-off parts of other chip companies, and with one opportunistic acquisition after another grew On Semi from a company with revenue of a little over $1 billion a year to $5.5 billion operation that for the last few years has been right around the cut-off point for the Fortune 500. El-Khoury is taking over the reins of a company that is at once a giant kludge and one of the most broadly diversified IC companies in the business.
